questions.question_text: In KPI Details, what happens when an indicator is forecasted to hit a future target?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
"An icon displays the status as On track, Off track, or Too early to track. This icon appears on both the chart and the Targets panel. The status is based on the predicted gap between target and score on the review date. Because the projected score is better than the target, the On track icon is displayed"
Source: https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/washingtondc-now-intelligence/page/use/par-for-workspace/concept/kpi-details-targets.html

When an indicator is forecasted to hit a future target in KPI Details, the action that occurs is:

D. The target owner is prompted to set a new Target Review date.

This prompt encourages the target owner to review and potentially update the target based on the forecasted achievement, ensuring that the goals remain relevant and challenging as circumstances change.

choices.B: The KPI status is set to On Track
choices.A: A new target is automatically set as an improvement of the current target
choices.D: The target owner is prompted to set a new Target Review date

choices.B: Security type: Whitelist / All roles: checked / Elements: 2 - High, 3 - Moderate, 4 - Low, 5 - Planning
choices.C: Security type: Blacklist / All roles: checked / Elements: 2 - High, 3 - Moderate, 4 - Low, 5 - Planning
choices.A: Security type: Blacklist / Roles: itil / Elements: 1 - Critical
choices.D: Security type: Whitelist / Roles: itil / Elements: 1 - Critical

discussion.content:
To hide the 1 - Critical priority incidents for ITIL users viewing the dashboard, the correct Breakdown Source security configuration would need to use a blacklist security type, as this explicitly prevents certain elements from being displayed. Given the options:

C. Security type: Blacklist / All roles: checked / Elements: 2 - High, 3 - Moderate, 4 - Low, 5 - Planning

This configuration would effectively hide the '1 - Critical' incidents from ITIL users since it blacklists all other priorities for visibility, implying that '1 - Critical' is not visible to any role.

KPI Signals supports notifications by sending email notifications to responsible users in various circumstances: when a new signal is detected on a KPI they are responsible for, when no signal has been detected on a KPI long enough for it to be considered long-term stable (an "anti-signal"), when a signal for a KPI they are responsible for is resolved (baseline reset or dismissal), and when a signal for a KPI they are responsible for has not been resolved according to subsequent signal collection jobs【15†servicenow-washingtondc-now-intelligence-enus.pdf】. Therefore, the answer to your question is B. By automated signal detection jobs.

questions.question_text: How does KPI Signals support notifications?

choices.C: The number on incidents inserted into the instance yesterday
choices.B: Number of Indicator Source records examined
choices.D: Number of Performance Analytics scores stored
choices.A: The sum of the stored scores

discussion.content:
The number of “Inserts” in a Job Log record represents:

D. Number of Performance Analytics scores stored.

This refers to the number of new records created as a result of a job, such as data collection jobs in Performance Analytics which insert new score records into the database.

questions.question_text: What does the number of “Inserts” represent in a Job Log record?
Which should you implement to obtain insights on new and returning platform users and their navigation patterns?

discussion.content:
To obtain insights on new and returning platform users and their navigation patterns, you should implement:

A. User Experience Analytics

User Experience Analytics provides detailed analytics on how users are interacting with the ServiceNow platform, including insights on user engagement, behavior, navigation patterns, and usage trends. This can be particularly helpful in understanding and improving the overall user experience on the platform.
